spacecraft_description: The Magellan spacecraft was launched by the Space Shuttle Atlantis on May 4, 1989. The spacecraft reached Venus orbit on August 10, 1990, and performed radar mapping and other scientific experiments.
thermal_description:
A solar thermal vacuum (STV) test was performed in the on-orbit configuration. The spacecraft overall thermal balance was within about 5°C of predictions in nearly all cases.

After the first solar exposure during cruise operations, the REMs (Rocket Engine Modules) were observed to be about 20°C above expected values. The SINDA thermal math model was upgraded to increase REM detail and prediction capability within <10°C.

The Hubble Space Telescope Servicing Mission 3B completed successfully in March 2002. This mission included installation of two new Solar Array (SA-3) assemblies. One of the concerns related to SA-3 was a possible mechanical disturbance caused by the quick temperature transition. Therefore, the Disturbance Verification Test (DVT) was conducted at the Large Space Simulator (LSS) chamber in the ESTEC facility, in October 2000. A mathematical thermal model of the test setup was constructed in TSS and SINDA. The thermal predictions were generated for the different test phases and compared to the flight thermal model predictions.

The Ulysses thermal model was developed in the 1980s as a 400-node SINDA model on a VAX platform, for evaluating steady state solutions.
Due to the limitations of the VAX system, it was decided to migrate the thermal model to PC-based thermal code, ESATAN.

spacecraft_description: STS-37 was the eighth flight of the shuttle Atlantis and the 39th shuttle flight.
The ocean Topography Experiment/Poseidon Mission (TOPEX/POSEIDON) is a joint project between NASA and CNES, to investigate the seasonal variations of the world's ocean circulations.
thermal_description: The spacecraft contractor, Fairchild Space Company, has provided spacecraft definitions that consist of both the TRASYS and SINDA models. The TRASYS model consists of 310 surfaces, and the SINDA transient thermal model includes over 500 nodes.
The TRASYS model consists of 223 nodes. The SINDA flight model consists of 246 diffusion nodes, 2 boundary nodes, 323 linear conductors and 2643 radiation conductors.

Detailed radiation and conduction thermal models of the secondary mirror assembly were developed using I-DEAS/TMG. The NEVADA program was utilized to generate the solar loads on the secondary mirror assembly for 213 different sun vectors.
The radiative exchange factors and the external fluxes to the Huygens probe are calculated by THERMICA.

spacecraft_description: SEDSAT 1 is a cubic satellite with a size of 34 × 34 × 30.5 cm³ and weighing about 37 kg.
thermal_description: SEDSAT 1 has an in-orbit temperature requirement band between 5 °C and 15 °C, due to the NiM Hydride batteries and the solar cells. The latest SINDA/NEVADA model of SEDSAT 1 consists of 48 nodes.

spacecraft_description: WE WISH (World Environmental Watching & Investigation from Space Height) is a 1U CubeSat developed by the Japanese company Meisei Electric. WE WISH was deployed from the Japanese Experiment Module (JEM) of the International Space Station (ISS) on 2012-10-04. WE WISH re-entered Earth's atmosphere on 2013-03-11.
thermal_description: For the thermal design of WE WISH, ANSYS Mechanical APDL and Thermal Desktop were used as the analysis software. Thermal Desktop model was developed for the orbital heat flux calculation with reduced number of nodes.

spacecraft_description: DIWATA-1 is the first Philippine-made micro satellite with the size of 55 x 35 x 55 cm³. DIWATA-1 was launched by the Atlas V rocket on 2016-03-23, and it was deployed from was deployed from the Japanese Experiment Module (JEM) of the International Space Station (ISS).

Miniature X-ray Solar Spectrometer (MinXSS) is a 3U CubeSat with the primary science instrument, a modified Amptek X-123 silicon drift detector soft X-ray spectrometer. MinXSS-1 was launched on 2015-12-06 to the ISS, and deployed from the airlock on 2016-05-16. MinXSS-1 has been stably sun pointed for the entire mission, which ended on 2017-05-06.

6U CubeSat KITSUNE was deployed from International Space Station (ISS) in March 2022. KITSUNE's main mission is the demonstration of a high-resolution camera based on COTS and high speed communication with C-band.

ONGLAISAT is a 6U class Earth observation satellite, developed in collaboration with Taiwan Space Agency (TASA) and the Intelligent Space Systems Laboratory (ISSL) of the University of Tokyo. On 2024-11-04, ONGLAISAT was successfully launched by SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket as part of 31st Commercial Resupply Service mission (CRS-2 SpX-31) to the ISS.

thermal_description: Enhanced Thematic Mapper Plus (ETM+) instrument TMM and GMM, developed by Hughes/Santa Barbara Remote Sensing (SBRS), were in CINDA and NEVADA formats. They were converted into SINDA and TRASYS formats at GSFC so that they are compatible with the spacecraft thermal model at Lockheed Martin.

spacecraft_description: SACI-1 (Satélite de Aplicações Científicas) is the first Brazilian scientific satellite, developed by INPE (Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas Espaciais). It was launched by Chinese rocket Long March 4 in October 1999. However, the communication with the satellite could not establisehd and the mission was aborted.

thermal_description:
The Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS) instrument provides high radiometric sensitivity (12 bit) in 36 spectral bands ranging in wavelength from 0.4 µm to 14.4 µm.
One major concern is the thermal distortions resulting from on-orbit thermal variations and from the heat loads generated by the electric modules and calibrators operating in a variety of modes and combinations. Thus, a series of analyses were performed to asses the structural, thermal and optical (STOP analysis) performance of the MODIS.

ASTER consists of three radiometers: Visible and Near Infrared Radiometer (VNIR), Short Wave Infrared Radiometer (SWIR), and Thermal Infrared Radiometer (TIR), and a Master Power Supply (MPS), and a Common Signal Processor (CSP).

spacecraft_description: The Mission Demonstration test Satellite-1 (MDS-1) is a mini-satellite of 475 Kg with equipment composed of various COTS electronics. MDS-1 was launched by the second H-IIA on 2002-02-04, and inserted to the geostationary transfer orbit (GTO).
thermal_description: The thermal model was developed to simulate the in-orbit thermal behavior of MDS-1. The model consists of 597 nodes (bus system: 533 nodes, payloads: 64 nodes). The developed model presented that the difference between the analysis results and the measurement data is within 5°C for most equipment.

spacecraft_description: The AMOS-2 spacecraft is a GEO synchronous, three axes stabilized, communications satellite. AMOS-2 spacecraft was launched on December 2003, and since February 2004, it provides communication services and other modern applications.
thermal_description: The full detailed TMM consist of about 4300 elements. THERMICA was used for the calculation of the black and gray form factors of the different spacecraft surfaces and the external heat loads. The calculated radiation parameters by THERMICA were embedded into SINDA/G to perform tmperature calculations.

spacecraft_description: HIT-SAT is a nanosatellite with a size of 120 × 130 × 120 mm³ and a mass of 2.7 kg. It was launched by M-V-7 rocket into a sun-synchronous orbit of an altitude of 279–660 km and an inclination of 98.32 deg.
thermal_description:
As the HIT-SAT is placed in the terminator orbit (LTAN 0600), HIT-SAT is continuously illuminated by the Sun.
The thermal analysis is performed by using Thermal Desktop and SINDA/FLUINT. The analysis result shows that the sun-illuninated surface temperatures are 272–277 K, and the opposite surface temperatures are 267–271 K.
The thermal model consists of mesh, truss tube members, boom and satellite body. The result of the CFRP tubes shows minimum temperature of −170 °C.

The GOCI is composed of the telescope, FPA (Focal Plane Array), mechanisms, and secondary structure. The GOCI thermal model is made of thin shell plates thermal meshing with 3674 lumped thermal nodes.

spacecraft_description: Megha-Tropiques is a joint program between  ISRO and CNES for the atmospheric research. The satellite carries three payloads: MADRAS, SAPHIR, and SCARAB.
thermal_description:
SCARAB is a radiometer to measure the radiative flux at the top of the atmosphere. The instrument consists of two assemblies: the Optical Sensor Module (OSM) and the Electronic Module (EM). The SCARAB OSM 
SAPHIR is a microwave radiometer to scan the vertical profile and horizontal distribution of humidity. The instrument consists of two assemblieds: SAPHIR RF Unit (RFU) and SAPHIR Electronic Unit (EM).

spacecraft_description: The Space Communications and Navigation (SCaN) Testbed was launched aboard the JAXA HTV3 on 2012-08-20. On 2012-08-07, the SCaN Testbed was installed on the ISS PC ELC.
KSAT-2 is a 1U-CubeSat with two 100 × 100 mm² deployable solar panels. It was launched on 2014-02-28, and operated for about 80 days.
thermal_description: KSAT-2 thermal model consists of 22 nodes, and the numerical calculation was performed by using Scilab.

spacecraft_description: Hodoyoshi-1 is a micro stellite that is about 60 cm cube and 60kg.
thermal_description:
The external surface of the satellite is Alodine 1000. The satellite internal structures are black anodized. Between the external structure and internal structure, thermal isolators (glass epoxy) are inserted, so that the internal instruments are not directly influenced by the external structure's temperature variations.
Regrading the thermal anlysis, one-node and two-node analysis were performed with Fortran, and multi-node thermal analysis was performed with Thermal Desktop.
The Shinen2 SINDA model consists of 47 nodes. The thermal analysis was performed for the worst hot case and worst cold case to ensure the survival of electric components and batteries.

The Regolith X-ray Imaging Spectrometer (REXIS) instrument is one of the five payload instruments on the OSIRIS-Rex asteroid sample return mission. The REXIS instrument consists of two assemblies: the spectrometer and the solar X-ray monitor (SXM).
Two thermal models of the spectrometer were created in Thermal Desktop: reduced model with fewer than 100 nodes, and the detailed model with more than 2000 nodes.
For the SXM, one thermal model was created in Thermal Desktop with approximately 100 nodes.

Thermal models for Mole, Support Structure, Radiometer, and Back-end electronics were created using Thermal Desktop. Support Structure convective heat exchange with Martian atmosphere is modelled with a constant convective heat transfer coefficient. According to the MArs Pathfinder and Mars rover Sojourner tests: h = 1–2 W/m²K for wind speed of 0–5 m/sec.

spacecraft_description: The ECOSystem Spaceborne Thermal Radiometer Experiment on Space Station (ECOSTRESS) instrument is a multi-spectral thermal infrared imaging radiaometer. Ist primary mission is to investigate and understand how climate change affects water and carbon usage on Earth. ECOSTRESS was launched on 2018-06-29 by the SpaceX Falcon9 Rocket on the CRS-15 mission to the International Space Station (ISS), installed on the Japanese Experiment Module External Facility (JEM-EF), and completed nine months of operation in space.
thermal_description: The ECOSTRESS Heat Rejection System (HRS) is a single-phase liquid pumped fluid loop that was designed to collect 800W of payload heat dissipation and environmental heating. The working fluid is FC-72, a perfluorocarbon dielectric liquid by 3M. Fluid circulation is provided by the JEM-EF Active Thermal Control System (ATCS).

spacecraft_description: OMOTENASHI was launched by SLS rocket on November 16, 2022.

thermal_description: The SNIPE satellite thermal model was build with over 2100 nodes as GMM by using Thermal Desktop. The TMM values were correlated with the thermal balance test using the genetic-algorithm-based multi-objective optimization algorithm NSGA-II.

spacecraft_description: The ARCADE (Atmospheric Coupling and Dynamics Explorer) is a 27U satellite developed by Satellite Research Centre (SaRC) at Nanyang Technological University (NTU).  The main payload in ARCADE is AtmoLITE (Atmospheric Limb Interferometer for Temperature Exploration), a near Infrared imager to explore Earth's Meteosphere Lower Termosphere (MLT).

The EarthCARE mission objective is the observation of clouds and aerosols from low Earth orbit. The payloads of the EarthCARE satellite include the W-band Cloud Profiling Radar (CPR), ATLID LIDAR, Broadband Radiometer (BBR), and the Multispectral Imager (MSI). The MSI instrument consists of two parts: the Visible, Near infrared and Short wave infrared (VNS) unit, and the Thermal InfraRed (TIR) unit.
Turksat 6A is the Turkey's first indigenous and national communications satellite.
thermal_description: TMM and GMM of the satellite are developed in MSC THERMICA 4.8.2 and the thermal analyses are executed in MSC Sinda.

spacecraft_description: The ³Cat 4 is the fourth mission in the CubeSat series developed by the Universitat Política de Catalunya (UPC) NanoSat Lab. The mission has three key objectives: the educational platform for graduate and undergraduate students, technological demonstration of the Flexible Microwave Payload (FMPL-1), and scientific experiments with Global Navigation Satellite System Reflectometry (GNSS-R).

thermal_description: The meshed thermal model of AlainSat-1 consists of 20816 elements. Using a workstation Windows 10 Enterprize woth 3.10 GHz Intel Core i9-9900 and 8 GB RAM, a steady state thermal analysis takes 3–5 min, and a transient thermal analysis takes 1–2 hours to reach convergence.

To cover the distinct mission phases, two thermal models were constructed: one for launch/transfer orbit, and another for synchronous orbit. The results of system level thermal analyses were used as boundary temperatures for the detailed analyses.
